result.execSummary:
The defendant Desmond Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant. Bail to apply to costs, assessments and surcharges.
Defendant to provide a specimen for DNA testing and pay the surcharge.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Do not use or possess any illegally controlled substances
AODA, treatment or programs as recommended. Random screening.

supervisions.notes:
Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 9-1-16 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.   
Court does not order any DNA surcharge on Counts 3 & 4.  
Bail to apply to costs, assessments and surcharges.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to Count 4 - with release privileges for the Day Reporting Program.
Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges.
The first 5 days are straight time - the balance can be with release privileges for the Day Reporting Program - no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program.

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Original SENTENCING Transcript (30 pages) commencing SEPTEMBER  21, 2015 by COURT REPORTER KELLY PIERCE.
court reporter request
Signed and filed. Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment-denied. Copies distributed to parties.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. David Swanson, Br. 11, calendar successor, for review. spc

Count 2.

(return address: Desmond Davis #639775, Juneau County Jail Contract, 200 Oak Street, Juneau, WI 53948).

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) do not use or possess any illegally controlled substances; 3) random screening; 4) obtain GED; 5) pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) obtain GED; 3) AODA, treatment or programs as recommended; 4) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 5) random screening;

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a specimen for DNA testing and pay the surcharge.

Count 3:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 30 days at the House of Correction - consecutive to Count 4 - with release privileges for the Day Reporting Program; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 9-1-16 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 4:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 6 months at the House of Correction - the first 5 days are straight time - the balance can be with release privileges for the Day Reporting Program - no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 9-1-16 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 
  Court does not order any DNA surcharge on Counts 3 & 4.  

Bail to apply to costs, assessments and surcharges. 

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Desmond Davis in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant. As to Count 2:  COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 30 months -  consecutive to Counts 3 & 4; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 18 months -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 12 months.   COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years - consecutive to Counts 3 & 4.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Desmond Davis in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

COUNTS 2, 3, AND 4:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Defense request for adjourned sentencing date granted.  Parties advised that written statements on behalf of the defendant must be submitted 72 hours prior to sentencing hearing to be considered by the court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Desmond Davis in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.
Defense counsel states that there is no right to substitution as per the statue in this case.  Defense requests a plea date.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Case adjourned for plea hearing on 9/9/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel would like to resolve the case.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Defense filed a substitution of counsel.  There is a co-defendant in this case in warrant status.  Parties not sure if a substitution can be done.  Defense to see if there is any case law on this topic.  Case adjourned for status on 6/30/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Desmond Davis in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Dennis Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/15/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Desmond Davis in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Desmond Davis in custody.  Zachary Wittchow for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #14CF2802 that are attached to the complaint.Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Department Officer Michael Driscoll.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Desmond Davis in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Desmond Davis in custody.  
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. 
Not Guilty Plea entered as to Count 3 and Count 4. 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
